title: Yami 'Rowdy' Lofvenberg: The top hip-hop dancer who can’t count the beats
description: Dancer Yami "Rowdy" Lofvenberg was labelled "stupid" at school. Now she has returned to education - as a lecturer.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'making tracks'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: The perfect storm striking World of Warcraft
description: All of a sudden, WoW players are in revolt, and its competitors are having a boom.

title: The X Factor: What became of the star-making hit show?
description: How the show that once topped viewing figures, and created big stars appears to have run its course.

title: ‘Lenders won’t touch us - my home’s worth nothing'
description: Campaigners say government attempts to unlock parts of the property market paralysed by the cladding crisis have stalled.

title: Heatwave risk from plans to convert shops to homes
description: Turning more commercial property into homes raises fears of sub-standard conditions, says a report.

title: Nairobi - the centre of East Africa's thriving arts scene
description: Artists from across East Africa have converged on Kenya's capital, creating a vibrant scene.

title: The autistic-friendly toy shop: 'We have got this'
description: Retail worker Romilly, who is autistic, wants to create a comfortable space for other autistic people to shop in.

title: What the Tokyo medal table tells us halfway through the Games
description: Simon Gleave from Nielsen Gracenote picks out some interesting data from the Olympic medal table at its halfway stage.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith pulls out of 200m after hamstring tear
description: Great Britain's world champion Dina Asher-Smith pulls out of the Olympic 200m after revealing she tore her hamstring earlier this month.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith reveals she tore her hamstring at British Olympic trials
description: Team GB's Dina Asher-Smith tells BBC Sport she tore her hamstring during the British Olympic trials after she failed to qualify for the Tokyo Olympics 100m final and pulled out of the 200m.

title: ICYMI: Decoding feline feelings and a breathtaking bungee jump
description: A round-up of the week's news you might have missed.

title: Billie Eilish opens up to Clara Amfo on trolls
description: Eilish tells Amfo of her frustration with internet criticism in a new documentary.

title: Covid vaccine not to be compulsory for university lectures
description: Ministers are no longer considering making two doses mandatory for students in England, the BBC learns.

title: Covid: Pulse oxygen monitors work less well on darker skin, experts say
description: Pulse oximeters, which spot falling oxygen levels, may work less well on darker skin, experts warn.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith & Asha Philip fail to qualify but Daryll Neita heads to 100m final
description: Watch highlights as Team GB's Dina Asher-Smith and Asha Philip fail to qualify for the 100m final but Daryll Neita advances as one of the fastest losers.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Karriss Artingstall takes bronze after Lauren Price guarantees medal
description: Karriss Artingstall takes Olympic bronze after a narrow defeat by Japan's Sena Irie, while Team GB team-mate Lauren Price beats Panama's Atheyna Bylon to guarantee at least a bronze.

title: Double GB gold in new mixed events
description: Great Britain kick off a golden Saturday by winning two of the new mixed relay events to take their total medal haul in Tokyo to 28.

title: Israel accuses Iran over deadly oil tanker attack
description: The country's foreign minister blames "Iranian terrorism" for an attack that left two people dead.

title: Asher-Smith fails to make 100m final but GB team-mate Neita through
description: Dina Asher-Smith fails to make the 100m final after clocking a below-par 11.05 seconds in the semi-final - but Great Britain team-mate Daryll Neita is through.

title: High Wycombe: Murder arrest after man found dead in street
description: Police officers found the victim in Micklefield Road, High Wycombe in the early hours of Saturday.

title: Djokovic beaten to Olympic singles bronze by Carreno Busta
description: Novak Djokovic throws one racquet and smashes another as his bid for an Olympic medal ends in defeat by Spain's Pablo Carreno Busta.

title: Tokyo Olympics: The medal winners' flowers that pay tribute to 2011 disaster
description: More than 5,000 bouquets are being handed to athletes at the Olympic and Paralympic Games - and have a special significance, with flowers from areas devastated by a 2011 earthquake and tsunami.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Novak Djokovic hurls and smashes racquet in bronze medal match defeat
description: Novak Djokovic displays his frustrations during his bronze medal match against Pablo Carreno Busta, throwing a racquet and then smashing another against a net post.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Jonny Brownlee, Adam Peaty and Lauren Price in day eight best bits
description: Watch the best moments from the early events on day eight at the Tokyo Olympics, including gold-winning relay races for Team GB and more boxing success.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain's Emma Wilson wins bronze in women's windsurfing
description: Great Britain's Emma Wilson celebrates a bronze medal on her Olympic debut in the women's windsurfing event at Tokyo 2020.

title: Escobar pub accused of glorifying drug lord's reign of terror
description: Colombians in Nottingham say they are disgusted at a new bar that shares the drug lord's surname.

title: Brighton Pride: Gala night kicks off scaled-back festivities
description: The launch night will feature an array of acts including cabaret, drag, live music and spoken word.

title: Pensioner Olympian Mike Bull still pole-vaulting at 74
description: Mike Bull is a double Commonwealth gold medallist and Olympic finalist in the sport.

title: The Papers: Summer breaks in Europe on 'brink' and 'hols hell'
description: Several of Saturday's front pages carry fears that Spain could be added to the UK's amber plus list.

title: Tokyo Olympics: GB win gold in 4x100m mixed medley relay in world-record time
description: Watch as Britain's Kathleen Dawson, Adam Peaty, James Guy and Anna Hopkin win mixed medley relay gold with a new world record at Tokyo 2020.

title: GB claim mixed medley swimming relay gold
description: Great Britain secure a fourth swimming gold at an Olympics for the first time in 113 years by winning the inaugural 4x100m mixed medley relay in a world-record time.

title: Simone Biles: Tokyo Olympics gymnast withdraws from two more events
description: American Simone Biles pulls out of the vault and uneven bars gymnastics finals at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Caeleb Dressel wins 100m butterfly gold for USA in world record time
description: Watch as USA's Caeleb Dressel win his third gold medal at the Tokyo Olympics Games and set a new 100m butterfly world record.

title: Imelda Staunton pictured as Queen in Netflix's The Crown for first time
description: Staunton takes on the role played by Claire Foy and Olivia Colman for the drama's fifth series.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Triathlon mixed relay gold for Learmonth, Brownlee, Taylor-Brown & Yee
description: Great Britain's Jessica Learmonth, Jonny Brownlee, Georgia Taylor-Brown and Alex Yee produce a superb performance to win gold in the first Olympic triathlon mixed relay.

title: Elon Musk: 'I don't want to be CEO of anything'
description: Elon Musk reiterated on Friday that he doesn't want to be Space X or Tesla boss. What's going on?

title: Guli Frances-Dehqhani: The bishop tackling England's housing crisis
description: The Church of England owns a lot of land - Guli Frances-Dehqhani wants to use it for the common good.
